segments.key_quote: who miss out the rare opportunity in the human form of life to put an end to this suffering of death and disease
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and contrasts intelligent people who hear Bhagavatam with lazy, less intelligent people who waste the opportunity of human life.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing from the 9th verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam: Mandasya Mandasya Prajnasya Vayo Mandayushas Chavai Nidrayahriyate Enaktam Divacha Vyartakarmabhihi. The meaning of this verse is: Lazy human beings with paltry intelligence and a short duration of life pass the night sleeping and the day performing activities that are for naught. So here, the description is being given by Shounaka Rishi. There are the intelligent people who engage in hearing Bhagavatam and escape the slaughtering process of Yamaraj, they escape death, they pass on from this body to Krishna's abode for eternal life, and then there are lazy, less intelligent, foolish human beings also who miss out the rare opportunity in the human form of life to put an end to this suffering of death and disease and

segments.key_quote: less intelligent means they misuse their intelligence for material sense enjoyment
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the characteristics of lazy and less intelligent people, emphasizing the misuse of intelligence for material enjoyment and the wasting of time in Kali Yuga.
segments.transcript: old age. They are described here. First of all, their characteristic is such unfortunate people are lazy. They are lazy, especially they are lazy when it comes to exerting oneself to hear Bhagavatam, lazy when it comes to chanting Hare Krishna, lazy when it comes to avoiding sinful activities, they're lazy. And another characteristic is paltry inclinations, paltry intelligence, very, very little brain substance, they're less intelligent. They're less intelligent. Now, less intelligent, does it mean that some people are born less intelligent, so what can they do? No, this is not what is meant by less intelligent. Less intelligent means they misuse their intelligence for material sense enjoyment. They don't utilize their intelligence for spiritual activities, for spiritual knowledge. They don't use their intelligence properly. That's the meaning here. Please don't misunderstand this. And the third characteristic is that life in Kali Yuga is characterized by short duration, and even that short duration of life they are wasting, completely losing out all the time available in this human body. In what way? At night they are simply engaged in sleeping, and in the daytime they are engaged in useless activities which are not at all helpful for their conquering death, that are not meant for conquering death, that are not meant for gaining eternal life. They are simply a waste of time. So Prabhupada describes about this

segments.key_quote: one has taken birth in this material world in a material body sure to die
segments.summary: The speaker quotes the Bhagavad Gita to emphasize the cycle of birth and death and the possibility of liberation in human form.
segments.transcript: repeated birth and death. This is explained in the Bhagavad Gita also: jaatas yahi dhruva mrtyur dhruvam janmam ritasya cha. So to get out of this is possible in the human form of life, and how do you take benefit of this human form of life to get out of the cycle of birth and death?

segments.summary: The speaker criticizes the pursuit of economic development and sense enjoyment, highlighting the temporary nature of material happiness.
segments.transcript: So such people, they become more interested in so-called economic development, work very hard throughout life simply for sense enjoyment of the temporary body. This body anyway is going to perish, it is simply meant for suffering, suffering something, but though they don't like suffering, they think I can overcome this suffering by replacing suffering with some material pleasure, and they have devised so many ways of trying to get some material pleasure by sense enjoyment. So we have senses, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the tongue, and the skin, and we also have the genitals, we have the belly, we have the voice, we have hands, we have legs, all this, all these senses for the materialistic persons, for the less intelligent persons, for the foolish persons, for the lazy persons, for the unfortunate persons, simply they want to use these for enjoying, enjoying, enjoying, enjoying material happiness, material, material, and what they don't realize is by the laws of nature every creature including the lower animals, birds, worms, insects, the aquatics, the plants, every living being is allowed by nature to enjoy certain type of sense pleasure. segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of a hog enjoying stool to illustrate that sense pleasure is available in all forms of life, not just human life.

segments.key_quote: They work simply for sense enjoyment, that's all. But that sense enjoyment is not at all giving us happiness or real pleasure.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the momentary and unsatisfying nature of sense enjoyment with the eternal and natural pleasure of the soul.
segments.transcript: It is available anyway in all forms of creature. Herein it is said that during the daytime one works for nothing. But this is waste of time. There is spiritual happiness which is not momentary, which is not by sense contact, which is the natural pleasure of the soul,
